p: The primary approach for combating emergent diseases, particularly viral diseases, is proactive, targeted antiviral prophylaxis (CDC 2006; WHO 2007b). Unfortunately, the constantly changing antigenic characteristics of viruses, particularly all influenza viruses, reduce efficacy of vaccinations (WHO 2006c). Moreover a myriad of technological issues pose serious hurdles to manufacturing and distribution of even small volumes of H5N1 vaccines (WHO 2006c). Furthermore, intercontinental migration of birds and international human travels further exacerbate effective containment and mitigation of epidemics.
